title: La Russia sta ritardando il memorandum sulla fine della guerra? Il Cremlino nega
cleaned_sentences: Moscow "welcomes the availability and efforts of all those countries that wish to contribute to a rapid solution" of the conflict Moscow - The spokesman for the Kremlin Dmitry Peskov said that Russia is not delaying the process for the preparation of a memorandum with Ukraine for the solution of the conflict in Ukraine.
"Nobody is interested in delaying the process, everyone is working dynamically, we will keep you informed," he told journalists.
"Of course, much of this work is done in a discreet way and should not be made public," added Peskov.

According to the latter, Russia has not yet received any proposal from the Vatican for a possible mediation on the conflict in Ukraine, but "welcomes the availability and efforts of all those countries that wish to contribute to a rapid solution".
"So far no decision has been made on the headquarters of further negotiations," added the spokesperson, cited by the Interfax agency.

Meanwhile, reports the "New York Times", the American president Donald Trump would have told Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other European leaders that Russia and Ukraine will have to find a solution to war, only a few days after supporting that only he and Russian president Vladimir Putin had the power to arrive at an agreement.
Trump, therefore, would have already decided.
The American leader, writes the newspaper that cites six officials aware of the talks, spoke with Zelensky and the other leaders after his telephone conversation had with Putin on Monday.

"The deepest question - comments the" New York Times " - is whether (the president) is also abandoning the project that America has been carrying out for three years to support Ukraine, a nascent democracy that he himself has often accused for being illegally invaded".
